segments.text: I notice the woman in her apron, lost in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's a sense of calm as she cleans, almost hypnotic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But beneath that calm, I feel a wave of anxiety rising.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and she doesn’t seem to see it at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if she’s in a bubble, untouched by the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the children are stirring mischief behind her, caught up in their own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy climbing the stool makes my breath catch; it feels so risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why would she let them do this, when it’s so obvious they could get hurt?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their laughter is a stark contrast to the looming disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between their joy outside and her focus signifies the divide in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR
